children.text: Wellyboots fosters a ‘culture of safety’ in which the children and staff are protected from abuse, harm, and distress.We therefore have a clear policy on the acceptable use of mobile phones that is understood and adhered to by everyone: staff, children and parents. Abiding by the terms of the club’s mobile phone policy ensures that we all:
Protect children from harm and abuse
Prevent staff from being subject to false allegations
Help staff remain focused on the care of children
Work in an open and transparent environment.
Each setting has it’s own mobile phone which is kept on the premises and locked away (filing cabinet)in the evening.
The Deputy managers are responsible for these mobile phones.
The setting mobile can be used to take photos of activities and experiences that the children share, they will be printed and deleted from the phone as soon as possible.
Staff use of mobile phones
Personal mobile phones belonging to members of staff are kept in their bag which is kept inside the locked filing cabinet during working hours.
If a member of staff needs to make an urgent personal call they can use the Wellyboots phone or make a personal call from their mobile outside the premises.
If a member of staff has a family emergency or similar and needs to keep their mobile phone to hand, prior permission must be sought from the Manager or Deputy.
Under no circumstances may staff use their personal mobile phones to take photographs at Wellyboots during working hours.
Children’s use of mobile phones
Whilst we understand that some children have mobile phones, we actively discourage them from using their phones within Wellyboots.
Wellyboots does not accept any responsibility for loss or damage to mobile phones brought to Wellyboots by the children.

Children must not use their mobile phone to take photographs of any kind whilst at Wellyboots. If they want a photograph of a particular activity they can ask a member of staff to take one using the Wellyboots camera.
Visitors’ use of mobile phones

Parents and all other visitors must not use their mobile phone – or any other device - to take photographs within Wellyboots. This includes taking photographs of their own children. If they want to have a photograph of their child involved in an activity or at play, parents can ask a member of staff to take one using the Wellyboots camera.
Related policies
See also: Safeguarding Children policy.
Written in accordance with the
Statutory Framework for the Early Years Foundation Stage (2021): Safeguarding and Welfare requirements: Child Protection [3.4].
